SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Emerald Diner relative to Stellar Bistro?
SRP.A: Emerald Diner is {below} Stellar Bistro in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total food cost percentage?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {The Golden Spoon}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total food cost percentage?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Stellar Bistro}.

VE.A: Crimson Plate's food cost percentage in 1950 is {30.63} %.

SC.Q: What is the average total Food Cost Percentage?

NC.Q: Between 1954 and 1967, did the total Food Cost Percentage experience a larger or smaller change than between 1967 and 1970?
NC.A: The change in total food cost percentage between 1954 and 1967 was {smaller} than between 1967 and 1970.

NC.Q: Between 1953 and 1967, did the total Food Cost Percentage experience a larger or smaller change than between 1951 and 1952?
NC.A: The change in total food cost percentage between 1953 and 1967 was {larger} than between 1951 and 1952.

NC.Q: Between 1961 and 1964, did the total Food Cost Percentage experience a larger or smaller change than between 1955 and 1972?
NC.A: The change in total food cost percentage between 1961 and 1964 was {smaller} than between 1955 and 1972.

NC.Q: Between 1950 and 1954, was the average total Food Cost Percentage higher or lower than between 1955 and 1971?
NC.A: The average total food cost percentage between 1950 and 1954 was {higher} than between 1955 and 1971.

MSR.Q: Which series has the largest cumulative area in this area chart?
MSR.A: {The Golden Spoon} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {Stellar Bistro, The Cozy Nook, Crimson Plate, Emerald Diner, Sky High Cafe, The Golden Spoon}.
